intro: Sobreyra oblonga, commonly known as the longleaf sobreyra, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pale yellow or white. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
